intro: Hieracium dolichaetoides, commonly known as the long-hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a central disc. It plays a role in supporting pollinators and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
